semantic_title: Hypertensive Chronic Kidney Disease Coding Guidelines
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 9. Chapter 9: Diseases of the Circulatory System > a. Hypertension > 2) Hypertensive Chronic Kidney Disease

content.full_text: Assign codes from category I12, Hypertensive chronic kidney disease, when both hypertension and a condition classifiable to category N18, Chronic kidney disease (CKD), are present. CKD should not be coded as hypertensive if the provider indicates the CKD is not related to the hypertension. The appropriate code from category N18 should be used as a secondary code with a code from category I12 to identify the stage of chronic kidney disease. See Section I.C.14. Chronic kidney disease. If a patient has hypertensive chronic kidney disease and acute renal failure, the acute renal failure should also be coded. Sequence according to the circumstances of the admission/encounter. (Evidence: pg no: 50, L55-L61)
content.summary: Guidelines for coding hypertensive chronic kidney disease using I12 category codes with N18 secondary codes for staging, including provisions for unrelated CKD and concurrent acute renal failure (Evidence: pg no: 50, L55-L61)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use I12 category codes when both hypertension and chronic kidney disease (N18) are present (Evidence: pg no: 50, L55-L56)
detailed_rules.explanation: When a patient has both hypertension and a condition classifiable to category N18 (Chronic kidney disease), assign codes from category I12 (Hypertensive chronic kidney disease) (Evidence: pg no: 50, L55-L56)
detailed_rules.applies_to: Concurrent hypertension and chronic kidney disease

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use appropriate N18 code as secondary code with I12 to identify CKD stage (Evidence: pg no: 50, L56-L57)
detailed_rules.explanation: The appropriate code from category N18 should be used as a secondary code along with a code from category I12 to identify the specific stage of chronic kidney disease (Evidence: pg no: 50, L56-L57)
detailed_rules.applies_to: All hypertensive chronic kidney disease cases

detailed_rules.rule_text: Do not code CKD as hypertensive if provider indicates CKD is not related to hypertension (Evidence: pg no: 50, L56)
detailed_rules.explanation: Chronic kidney disease should not be coded as hypertensive if the provider specifically indicates that the CKD is not related to the hypertension (Evidence: pg no: 50, L56)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Code acute renal failure additionally when present with hypertensive chronic kidney disease (Evidence: pg no: 50, L60-L61)
detailed_rules.explanation: If a patient has hypertensive chronic kidney disease and also has acute renal failure, the acute renal failure should also be coded in addition to the hypertensive chronic kidney disease codes (Evidence: pg no: 50, L60-L61)
detailed_rules.applies_to: Hypertensive CKD with concurrent acute renal failure
common_applications: Hospitalization for acute renal failure in CKD patient

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify presence of both hypertension and chronic kidney disease
Step 2: Check if provider documents CKD as unrelated to hypertension
Step 3: If unrelated, code separately; if related, use I12 category
Step 4: Assign appropriate N18 code as secondary for CKD staging
Step 5: Check for concurrent acute renal failure
Step 6: If acute renal failure present, add appropriate acute renal failure code
Step 7: Sequence according to admission/encounter circumstances
